page.title: 09EVENTS, STEAM RALLY
page.content: Historical detail..... {1968} 2 Fetes held in Knowl Hill to raise money for new Village Hall. {1970} Sponsors found to promote first{ {Steam Rally} using Fete funds. {1974}New Village Hall completed at a cost of{Â£31,000. } This Hall was built on land purchased from{H.F.Warner. } Further funds were made available from subsequent Steam Rallies for..... Purchase of adjoining gardens to Hall to provide additional {Car Parking.} Purchase of property (14, The Terrace) to provide{Doctors' Surgery }and convert 1st floor into a Flat. Rent on these is used to help run the Village Hall. {Trust Fund} for benefit of Knowl Hill established with proceeds of Rallies. Attendance over 2 days 50,000. Steam Engines paid to appear,+ coal.
